title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
code: # install development version devtools::install_github("danymukesha/GeneScout")

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: First, calculate codon frequencies Shannon entropy sequence:
code: # Example sequence (biased codon usage) sequence1 <- "ATGATGATGATGATGATGTTATTATTATTATTATTATTACGCCGCCGCCGCCGCC"  freqs <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence1) print(head(freqs[freqs > 0])) ##       TTA       CGC       ATG  ## 0.3888889 0.2777778 0.3333333 entropy <- calculate_shannon_entropy(freqs) print(paste("Shannon Entropy:", round(entropy, 3), "bits")) ## [1] "Shannon Entropy: 1.572 bits"

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: de novo discovery, create reference profile known genes:
code: # Known gene sequences (would normally be from annotated genes) known_genes <- c(   "ATGATGATGATGCCGCCGCCGCCTTATTATTATTAG",   "ATGCCGCCGCCGCCATTATTATTAATGTTTTTTTTT",   "ATGTTTTTTTTTTTACGCCGCCGCCGCCGAGTAA" )  # Create reference codon usage profile ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes, method = "mean") print(head(ref_profile[ref_profile > 0])) ##        CCA        CGA        GTA        TTA        CGC        TAG  ## 0.02777778 0.03030303 0.03030303 0.11363636 0.12121212 0.02777778

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Perform genome-wide scan find regions matching reference profile:
code: # Create a longer test sequence with embedded "gene-like" regions test_sequence <- paste0(   paste0(rep("ACGTACGTACGT", 30), collapse = ""),  # Random region   "ATGATGATGATGCCGCCGCCGCCTTATTATTATTA",       # Embedded ORF   paste0(rep("TGACTGACTGA", 30), collapse = ""), # Random region   "ATGCCGCCGCCGCCATTATTATTAATGTTTTTTTTTTAG",   # Another ORF   paste0(rep("GATCGATCGAT", 30), collapse = "") # Random region )   # Scan with sliding window scan_result <- sliding_window_scan(   test_sequence,   window_size = 150,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = ref_profile )  # View results print(scan_result) ## GeneScout Sliding Window Scan Results ## ======================================= ## Number of windows: 32  ## Sequence range: 1 - 1080 bp ##  ## Entropy Statistics: ##   Mean Shannon Entropy: 2.665 bits ##   Std. Dev. Shannon Entropy: 0.598 bits ##   Min Shannon Entropy: 1.999 bits ##   Max Shannon Entropy: 3.896 bits ##  ## KL Divergence Statistics: ##   Mean KL Divergence: 23.452  ##   Std. Dev. KL Divergence: 3.108

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Identify regions unusually low entropy:
code: # Detect peaks in entropy profile peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(   scan_result,   metric = "shannon_entropy",   method = "quantile",   threshold = 0.1,   min_peak_width = 3 )  print(peaks) ##   peak_id start_window end_window num_windows start_bp end_bp metric_value_mean ## 1       1            1          8           8        1    360          1.998846 ##   metric_value_min ## 1         1.998846

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Search actual ORFs within low-entropy peaks:
code: # Find candidate ORFs candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(   test_sequence,   scan_result,   peaks,   min_orf_length = 60,   start_codons = c("ATG"),   stop_codons = c("TAA", "TAG", "TGA") )  print(candidates) ## # A tibble: 0 × 0

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Create plots visualize entropy profiles candidate ORFs:
code: # Plot entropy profile plot_entropy_profile(scan_result,                       metric = "shannon_entropy",                      highlight_threshold = TRUE) # Plot with peaks highlighted plot_entropy_profile(scan_result,                       peaks = peaks,                      metric = "shannon_entropy",                      show_peaks = TRUE) # Plot candidate ORFs plot_candidate_orfs(scan_result, candidates, peaks, metric = "shannon_entropy")

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Compare entropy profiles different regions:
code: # Create two different sequences # APOE coding region (simulated longer fragment for demo, ~4 kb) seq_region1 <- paste0(     "ATGGAGGAGCCGCAGTCAGATCCTAGCGTCGAGCAGGAGAGCTGCGGGAGGAGCGGAGGCTG",     "GAGGCCGCGGAGGAGCTGGCGGAGGCGGAGGAGGCGGAGGAGCCGCGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAG",     "GCCGCGGAGGAGGCGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GCCGCGGAGGAGGCGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA",     "GAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGAGGA" ) # Random-like region from chr19 (simulated, ~4 kb) seq_region2 <- paste0(     "GCGTACGTAGCTAGCGTAGCTACGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCAGTGCTAGCTAGCTAGCGTAC",     "GATCGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCGTACGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTGACGAT",     "CGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTACGATGCTAGCTAGCTGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCGTAC",     "GATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTACGATGCTAGCTA",     "TACGATCGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCGTACGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTGAC",     "GATCGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTACGATGCTAGCTAGCTGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCG",     "TACGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTACGATGCTAG",     "CTATACGATCGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCGTACGATCGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCT",     "GACGATCGTAGCTAGCTGACGATCGTACGATGCTAGCTAGCTGATCGTAGCTAGCTAGCTA" )  # Scan both regions result1 <- sliding_window_scan(seq_region1, window_size = 100, step_size = 20) result2 <- sliding_window_scan(seq_region2, window_size = 100, step_size = 20)  # Compare profiles compare_entropy_profiles(result1, result2,                           labels = c("Gene-like region", "Random region"))

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: large genomes, process chromosome chromosome:
code: # Read genome FASTA file (https://parasite.wormbase.org/index.html) genome <- read_fasta("../data/acanthocheilonema_viteae.PRJEB1697.WBPS19.genomic.fa")  # Extract known genes from GTF annotation file known_genes <- extract_known_genes(   gtf_file = "../data/acanthocheilonema_viteae.PRJEB1697.WBPS19.canonical_geneset.gtf",   genome_fasta = "../data/acanthocheilonema_viteae.PRJEB1697.WBPS19.genomic.fa",   feature_type = "gene",   min_length = 150,   max_genes = 1000 )  # Create reference profile from extracted genes ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes[1:11])  # Process one chromosome chr_name <- names(genome)[1] chr_sequence <- as.character(genome[1])  # Scan chromosome chr_scan <- sliding_window_scan(   chr_sequence,   window_size = 300,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = ref_profile )  # Detect peaks and find ORFs peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(chr_scan, threshold = 0.05) candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(chr_sequence, chr_scan, peaks)  # Save results write.csv(candidates, paste0("candidates_", chr_name, ".csv"))

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Shannon entropy measures “surprise” randomness data: H=−∑=164P()log2P()H = -\sum_{=1}^{64} P() \log_2 P() P()P() frequency codon ii. High entropy (~6 bits): Random codon usage (non-coding DNA) Low entropy (~3-4 bits): Biased codon usage (potential gene)

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: KL divergence measures one distribution differs another: DKL(P∥Q)=∑iP()log2(P()Q())D_{KL}(P \| Q) = \sum_{} P() \log_2 \left( \frac{P()}{Q()} \right) P()P() observed frequency Q()Q() reference frequency. High KL: Window differs organism’s typical codon usage Low KL: Window matches organism’s typical codon usage

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: ENC another measure codon usage bias: ENC ranges 20 (extreme bias) 61 (bias).
code: # Calculate ENC for different sequences seq_uniform <- paste(rep(c("ATG", "TTT", "CCC", "GGG", "AAA", "TTT"), 10),                       collapse = "") seq_biased <- paste(rep("ATG", 60), collapse = "")  freqs_uniform <- calculate_codon_frequencies(seq_uniform) freqs_biased <- calculate_codon_frequencies(seq_biased)  enc_uniform <- calculate_enc(freqs_uniform) enc_biased <- calculate_enc(freqs_biased)  print(paste("Uniform sequence ENC:", round(enc_uniform, 2))) ## [1] "Uniform sequence ENC: 61" print(paste("Biased sequence ENC:", round(enc_biased, 2))) ## [1] "Biased sequence ENC: 61"

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: choice window size affects sensitivity: Small windows (50-100 bp): Higher sensitivity, noise Large windows (300-500 bp): stable, may miss small ORFs
code: # Compare different window sizes windows <- c(100, 150, 300)  results <- lapply(windows, function(ws) {   sliding_window_scan(test_sequence, window_size = ws, step_size = 30) })

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Step size determines resolution: Small step (10-20 bp): Fine-grained scan, slower Large step (30-50 bp): Faster scan, may miss features

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Use different methods set entropy thresholds:
code: # Quantile-based threshold peaks_quantile <- entropy_peak_detection(   scan_result,    method = "quantile",    threshold = 0.1 )  # Standard deviation-based threshold peaks_sd <- entropy_peak_detection(   scan_result,    method = "sd",    threshold = 1.5 )

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: validation, integrate RNA-seq expression data:
code: # Load RNA-seq coverage data coverage <- readRDS("rnaseq_coverage.rds")  # Add expression information to candidates candidates_with_expr <- dplyr::mutate(candidates,   mean_coverage = sapply(1:nrow(candidates), function(i) {     mean(coverage[candidates$start[i]:candidates$end[i]])   }) )  # Filter by expression expressed_candidates <- dplyr::filter(   candidates_with_expr,   mean_coverage > 5 )

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: large genomes: Process chromosome: Avoid loading entire genome memory Use parallel processing: Scan different chromosomes parallel Optimize parameters: Larger step sizes reduce computation Filter early: Exclude low-complexity regions scanning
code: # Parallel scanning example library(parallel) library(foreach) library(doParallel)  cl <- makeCluster(detectCores() - 1) registerDoParallel(cl)  results <- foreach(chr = chromosome_names) %dopar% {   chr_seq <- as.character(genome[chr])   sliding_window_scan(chr_seq, window_size = 300, step_size = 30) }  stopCluster(cl)

title: GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery
text: Wright, F. (1990). ‘effective number codons’ used gene. Gene, 87(1), 23-29. Sharp, P. M., & Li, W. H. (1987). codon Adaptation Index-measure directional synonymous codon usage bias, potential applications. Nucleic Acids Research, 15(3), 1281-1295.

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
text: Many genomes studied detail still contain regions DNA thought “non-coding”, regions may actually hide small genes. GeneScout uses codon usage statistics entropy analysis identify hidden genes analyzing patterns DNA codes proteins measuring sequence complexity. demonstrate using: APOE gene known coding reference. Chromosome 19 segments (chr19) genome scan.

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
code: chr19 <- GeneScout::read_fasta("../data/chr19.fasta") apoe_sequence <-  GeneScout::read_fasta("../data/APOE.fasta")[1] # chr19: DNAStringSet with multiple segments # apoe_sequence: DNAStringSet containing APOE chr19_seq <- chr19[[460]]         # take 460 segment for demonstration apoe_seq <- apoe_sequence[[1]]    # APOE gene sequence

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
code: # Calculate codon frequencies for APOE apoe_codon_freq <- calculate_codon_frequencies(apoe_seq) print(head(apoe_codon_freq[apoe_codon_freq > 0])) ##         AAA         CAA         GAA         TAA         ACA         CCA  ## 0.020260492 0.010130246 0.017366136 0.007235890 0.008683068 0.024602026 # Shannon entropy of APOE sequence apoe_entropy <- calculate_shannon_entropy(apoe_codon_freq) paste("APOE Shannon Entropy:", round(apoe_entropy, 3), "bits") ## [1] "APOE Shannon Entropy: 5.624 bits"

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
code: # Using APOE as the reference gene for codon usage ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(list(apoe_seq), method = "mean") print(head(ref_profile[ref_profile > 0])) ##         AAA         CAA         GAA         TAA         ACA         CCA  ## 0.020260492 0.010130246 0.017366136 0.007235890 0.008683068 0.024602026

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
text: scan full segment chr19 (safe coordinates):
code: chr19_region <- subseq(chr19_seq, start = 1, end = length(chr19_seq))

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
code: scan_result <- sliding_window_scan(     chr19_region,     window_size = 150,     step_size = 30,     reference_profile = ref_profile ) # Inspect first few rows head(scan_result) ## GeneScout Sliding Window Scan Results ## ======================================= ## Number of windows: 6  ## Sequence range: 1 - 300 bp ##  ## Entropy Statistics: ##   Mean Shannon Entropy: 4.712 bits ##   Std. Dev. Shannon Entropy: 0.117 bits ##   Min Shannon Entropy: 4.513 bits ##   Max Shannon Entropy: 4.837 bits ##  ## KL Divergence Statistics: ##   Mean KL Divergence: 1.397  ##   Std. Dev. KL Divergence: 0.149

title: GeneScout on APOE and chr19
code: peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(     scan_result,     metric = "shannon_entropy",     method = "quantile",     threshold = 0.1,     min_peak_width = 3 )  peaks ##   peak_id start_window end_window num_windows start_bp end_bp metric_value_mean ## 1       1           28         30           3      811   1020          4.507292 ## 2       2          125        127           3     3721   3930          4.459936 ## 3       3          162        164           3     4831   5040          4.537767 ## 4       4          209        211           3     6241   6450          4.494005 ##   metric_value_min ## 1         4.448367 ## 2         4.323074 ## 3         4.518563 ## 4         4.431272

what: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: GeneScout R package identifying hidden genes non-coding DNA using statistical information theory. implements sliding window entropy scanning, Shannon entropy calculation, Kullback-Leibler divergence discover potential small open reading frames (ORFs) genomic sequences without requiring prior annotation. existing bioinformatics tools codon usage bias analysis (like coRdon Biostrings) designed analyzing known genes annotated GTF/GFF files. optimized discovery non-coding regions. GeneScout fills gap focusing de novo small ORF discovery large genomic regions. key features tool : Sliding window entropy scanning: implementation efficiently scan millions base pairs find regions unusual codon usage patterns Shannon entropy calculation: measures randomness codon distributions Kullback-Leibler divergence: Compare regions organism-specific codon usage profiles ORF setection: Find candidate open reading frames low-entropy regions Reference profil creation: build organism-specific codon usage profiles known genes

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
code: # install development version devtools::install_github("danymukesha/GeneScout")

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
code: library(GeneScout)  # Create a reference profile from known genes known_genes <- c("ATGATGATG", "GCCGCCGCC", "TTATTATTA") ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes)  # Scan a genomic sequence sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 30), collapse = "") scan_result <- sliding_window_scan(   sequence,   window_size = 300,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = ref_profile )  # Detect entropy peaks peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(scan_result, threshold = 0.1)  # Find candidate ORFs candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, scan_result, peaks)  # Visualize results plot_candidate_orfs(scan_result, candidates, peaks)

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: H=−∑=164P()log2P()H = -\sum_{=1}^{64} P() \log_2 P() High entropy (~6 bits): Random codon usage → non-coding DNA Low entropy (~3-4 bits): Biased codon usage → potential gene

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: DKL(P∥Q)=∑iP()log2(P()Q())D_{KL}(P \| Q) = \sum_{} P() \log_2 \left( \frac{P()}{Q()} \right) Compares observed codon distribution (PP) reference distribution (QQ). different use cases, : De nove gene dscovery: find potential coding regions unannotated genomes Small ORF identification: discovering small peptides non-coding regions Comparative genomics: comparing codon usage organisms RNA-Seq integration: validating candidate ORFs expression data Evolutionary studies: analze codon usage patterns across lineages

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: Built top Bioconductor’s excellent Biostrings, coRdon, ggplot2 packages.

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: Calculate frequency distribution 64 codons DNA sequence.

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
code: calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence, normalize = TRUE)

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence normalize Boolean indicating whether normalize frequencies (default: TRUE)

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: Named numeric vector codon frequencies

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
code: sequence <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" frequencies <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence)

what: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: Calculate Effective Number Codons (ENC), measure codon usage bias. ENC ranges 20 (extreme bias) 61 (bias).

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
code: calculate_enc(frequencies)

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: frequencies Named numeric vector codon frequencies

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: Numeric value ENC

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
code: sequence <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" freqs <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence) enc <- calculate_enc(freqs)

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: Calculate Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence two codon frequency distributions. measures one distribution diverges second, expected distribution.

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
code: calculate_kl_divergence(observed, reference, epsilon = 1e-10)

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: observed Named numeric vector observed codon frequencies reference Named numeric vector reference codon frequencies epsilon Small value avoid log(0) (default: 1e-10)

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: Numeric value KL divergence

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
code: sequence1 <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" sequence2 <- "TTATTATTACGCCGCCGCCATGATGATG" freqs1 <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence1) freqs2 <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence2) kl_div <- calculate_kl_divergence(freqs1, freqs2)

what: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
title: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
text: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage codon frequency distribution. RSCU > 1 indicates codon usage bias towards codon.

title: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
code: calculate_rscu(frequencies)

title: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
text: frequencies Named numeric vector codon frequencies

title: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
text: Named numeric vector RSCU values

title: Calculate Relative Synonymous Codon Usage (RSCU) — calculate_rscu
code: sequence <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" freqs <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence) rscu <- calculate_rscu(freqs)

title: Calculate Shannon Entropy — calculate_shannon_entropy
text: Calculate Shannon entropy codon frequency distribution.

title: Calculate Shannon Entropy — calculate_shannon_entropy
code: calculate_shannon_entropy(frequencies)

title: Calculate Shannon Entropy — calculate_shannon_entropy
text: frequencies Named numeric vector codon frequencies

title: Calculate Shannon Entropy — calculate_shannon_entropy
text: Numeric value Shannon entropy bits

title: Calculate Shannon Entropy — calculate_shannon_entropy
code: sequence <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" freqs <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence) entropy <- calculate_shannon_entropy(freqs)

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: Compare entropy profiles multiple sequences regions.

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
code: compare_entropy_profiles(..., metric = "shannon_entropy", labels = NULL)

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: ... One scan results named lists scan results metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence" labels Optional character vector labels profile

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: ggplot2 object

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
code: seq1 <- paste(rep("ATGATGATG", 30), collapse = "") seq2 <- paste(rep("ACGTACGT", 30), collapse = "") result1 <- sliding_window_scan(seq1, window_size = 100, step_size = 20) result2 <- sliding_window_scan(seq2, window_size = 100, step_size = 20) plot <- compare_entropy_profiles(result1, result2, labels = c("Region 1", "Region 2")) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the GeneScout package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/danymukesha/GeneScout/issues>.

title: Create Reference Codon Profile — create_reference_profile
text: Create reference codon usage profile known genes set training sequences. profile represents organism's codon usage bias pattern.

code: create_reference_profile(sequences, method = "mean")

title: Create Reference Codon Profile — create_reference_profile
text: sequences Character vector, DNAStringSet, list DNA sequences method Character string: "mean" "median" aggregating frequencies

title: Create Reference Codon Profile — create_reference_profile
text: Named numeric vector representing reference codon frequencies

title: Create Reference Codon Profile — create_reference_profile
code: known_genes <- c("ATGATGATG", "GCCGCCGCC", "TTATTATTA") ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes)

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: Identify peaks entropy profiles may indicate potential coding regions.

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
code: entropy_peak_detection(   scan_result,   metric = "shannon_entropy",   method = "quantile",   threshold = 0.1,   min_peak_width = 3 )

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence" method Character string: "quantile" "sd" threshold calculation threshold Quantile threshold ("quantile" method) number SDs ("sd" method) min_peak_width Minimum width peaks windows (default: 3)

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: Data frame peak information

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold

what: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: Extract gene sequences GTF/GFF annotation file corresponding genome FASTA. function parses annotation file get gene coordinates extracts sequences genome FASTA file.

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
code: extract_known_genes(   gtf_file,   genome_fasta,   feature_type = "gene",   gene_attribute = "gene_id",   min_length = 300,   max_genes = Inf )

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: gtf_file Character string specifying path GTF/GFF file genome_fasta Character string specifying path genome FASTA file feature_type Character string specifying feature type extract (default: "gene", alternatives: "exon", "CDS", "transcript") gene_attribute Character string specifying gene ID attribute (default: "gene_id") min_length Minimum gene length base pairs (default: 300) max_genes Maximum number genes extract (default: Inf)

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: Character vector gene sequences

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Extract gene sequences from GTF and genome files known_genes <- extract_known_genes(     gtf_file = "annotations.gtf",     genome_fasta = "genome.fasta",     min_length = 300 )  # Create reference profile ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes) } # }

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: Identify candidate open reading frames (ORFs) based entropy analysis sequence features.

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
code: find_candidate_orfs(   sequence,   scan_result,   peaks,   min_orf_length = 90,   start_codons = c("ATG"),   stop_codons = c("TAA", "TAG", "TGA") )

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() peaks Data frame entropy_peak_detection() min_orf_length Minimum ORF length base pairs (default: 90, .e., 30 aa) start_codons Character vector valid start codons (default: c("ATG")) stop_codons Character vector stop codons (default: c("TAA", "TAG", "TGA"))

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: Data frame candidate ORF information

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, result, peaks) #> Warning: No peaks provided, returning empty data frame

text: sequence Character string DNA sequence min_orf_length Minimum ORF length base pairs start_codons Character vector start codons stop_codons Character vector stop codons

title: Find ORFs in Sequence — find_orfs_in_sequence
text: Data frame ORF information

text: Visualize candidate ORFs along entropy profile.

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
code: plot_candidate_orfs(   scan_result,   candidates,   peaks = NULL,   metric = "shannon_entropy" )

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
text: scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() candidates Data frame find_candidate_orfs() peaks Optional data frame entropy_peak_detection() metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence"

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, result, peaks) #> Warning: No peaks provided, returning empty data frame plot <- plot_candidate_orfs(result, candidates, peaks)

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: Perform sliding window scan across DNA sequence calculate entropy KL divergence metrics position. main function de novo ORF discovery.

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
code: sliding_window_scan(   sequence,   window_size = 300,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = NULL,   min_codons = 10 )

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence window_size Integer size sliding window base pairs (default: 300) step_size Integer step size sliding window (default: 30) reference_profile Optional reference codon frequency profile. NULL, Shannon entropy calculated. min_codons Minimum number complete codons required analysis (default: 10)

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: data frame window coordinates entropy metrics

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30)
